column4: ok, I'm trying to install ubuntu feisty on a new AMD64 Athlon x2 machine.  Whether I choose the 32bit or 64 bit version, I only get as far as loading the liveCD when it seems something times out and I'm left with a busybox prompt and a message that bin/sh can't access tty.  Help!
anyone have any idea what to do when presented with a busybox shell and job control turned off?
did you try memtest86?  perhaps you have some bad ram thats causing problems?
